intro: Senecio andryaloides, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and dark brown central disk florets. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Senecio andryaloides is cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
